item.title: Police launch homicide investigation after Ōtaki death
item.description:
Police are treating a sudden death in Ōtaki yesterday as a homicide.
Emergency services were called to a Mill Rd address about 7.40pm yesterday, where a man in his 50s was reportedly injured.

item.title: Sport's $265m injection: Cash available in days for lost incomes
item.description:
The decimated sports industry has been thrown a $265 million lifeline to help it survive the fallout from the Covid-19 crisis.
The focus of the package is to help the sector survive the initial impact ...

item.title: Liam Dann: We did it - now comes the shock of ordinary life
item.description:
Now what New Zealand?
We did it.
We got through lockdown. We crushed the Covid-19 curve. We're open for business.
We didn't even run out of toilet paper.
If we take a deep breath and look back ...

item.title: New research: Loud talking can leave coronavirus in air for 14 minutes
